item.title: Report E-2024110483
item.description:
Report E-2024110483

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-27T12:24:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-29
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO contacted ERTS at 0916 EST to report a 0.25-gallon spill THINNER PH 400 located in a trailer at Terminal LHO. ERTS reviewed the SDS with Mark and clean-up was conducted internally utilizing recommended PPE from the SDS. Waste was generated to a 95-gallon DF containing damaged paint pails, PPE, shrink-wrap, and used cleaning supplies.

item.title: Report E-2024110504
item.description:
Report E-2024110504

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-27T12:24:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-26
  • City: PASADENA
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG Energy, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5550
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was in the course of delivering gasoline into the customer's storage tank. A vehicle drove through the coned off delivery area and struck the hose adaptor. This caused the connection between the hose adaptor and storage tank to become compromised and resulted in 15 gallons of gasoline being released. Lone Star environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation .

item.title: Report X-2024110902
item.description:
Report X-2024110902

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-16
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. Outer box labeled with NFPS/HMIS label. SDS was inside along with 4 X 1 gallon plastic bottles; each bottle was inside of a plastic bag. Unknown how the plastic bottle leaked, possibly punctured. Plastic Bottles are labeled as PERFECT SCORE HIGH PERFORMANCE HP-5503 CUTTING FLUID. All contents were placed in a salvage drum and held for FAA investigation.

item.description:
Report E-2024110463

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-24
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG SPECIALTY PRODUCTS GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5025
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Specialty Products Group, LLC unit was in transit when it was discovered that there was a slow leak coming from the shell of the trailer. Approximately 10 gallons of acrylic acid was released. E3 Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report X-2024110614
item.description:
Report X-2024110614

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-03
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During an FRA inspection an odor was detected around the tank car. Upon closer inspection of the combination housing the liquid valve was found to be partially open and the secondary closure plug was loose. Contractor secured the valve and plug and released to destination.

item.title: Report I-2024100137
item.description:
Report I-2024100137

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-06
  • City: ENCINAL
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: NATIONAL FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. While making a delivery, one damaged super sack was discovered. The load was refused by the consignee. CG Environmental was dispatched to inspect the trailer and perfotm the cleanup. CG Environmental inspected the trailer and discovered one damaged super sack. CG recovered approximately 1/4 pound of product and placed into a drum for disposal. The damaged bag was taped to prevent any additional product from leaking from the bag.
